com.github.mlk.instancelock
Class InstanceLock

java.lang.Object
  com.github.mlk.instancelock.InstanceLock

public final class InstanceLock
extends Object

Prevents two instances of the application from starting at the same time.

Constructor Summary

          Controls access to this application.

          Controls access to this application.

Constructor Detail

InstanceLock

public InstanceLock(String applicationName)
Controls access to this application.

Parameters:
applicationName - A unique name for the starting application. Use the fully qualified name for "main".

InstanceLock

public InstanceLock(String applicationName,
                    ApplicationStartupListener applicationStartupListener)
Controls access to this application.

Parameters:
applicationName - A unique name for the starting application. Use the fully qualified name for "main".
applicationStartupListener - This is informed when second instances of the application is started if the second instance chooses to send a message.
Method Detail

onlyInstance

public boolean onlyInstance()
Is this the only instance of this application currently executing. If it is the only instance running it takes the locks.

Returns:
Is this the only instance of the application running?

onlyInstance

public boolean onlyInstance(String message)
Is this the only instance of this application currently executing. If it is the only instance running it takes the locks.

Parameters:
message - If this is not the only instance of the application running then this message is sent to the other instance.
Returns:
Is this the only instance of the application running?

closeInstance

public void closeInstance()
Releases the lock this instance has and tidies up. You do not need to call this as it will be called on application shutdown using Runtime.addShutdownHook(...). NOTE: If this is not called before the application is terminated then the system will still unlock, but a 0k file will be left in the users home directory.

forceCheck

public void forceCheck()
Forces a check for new messages from secondary applications. Should only be used during testing.

addShutdownHook

protected void addShutdownHook()
Adds a shutdown hook which releases the lock and tidies up.
